api/auth/overview.title: Authentication Overview
api/auth/overview.description: Terrarium uses JSON Web Tokens (JWT) for API authentication. This guide will walk you through the authentication process and best practices.

api/auth/security.description: Learn how to secure your Terrarium API integration.

api/authentication.description: Learn how to authenticate your API requests.

api/endpoints/communities.description: Manage your communities through the API.

api/endpoints/jobs.description: Manage job listings through the API.

api/overview.title: API Overview
api/overview.description: Terrarium provides a RESTful API that enables you to programmatically manage your communities, job boards, and user data.

api/playground.title: API Playground
api/playground.description: Try out our API endpoints directly in the documentation. Each playground includes a live editor where you can modify the request and see the response in real-time.

getting-started/configuration.description: Learn how to configure your Terrarium instance.

getting-started/installation.title: Installation
getting-started/installation.description: Setting up Terrarium in your environment is straightforward. Follow these steps to get started.

introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.description: Welcome to the Terrarium documentation. This documentation site contains comprehensive information about the Terrarium platform, including:

sdk/javascript.title: JavaScript/TypeScript SDK
sdk/javascript.description: Our JavaScript/TypeScript SDK provides a type-safe way to interact with the Terrarium API.

sdk/overview.title: SDK Overview
sdk/overview.description: Terrarium provides official SDKs for popular programming languages to help you integrate with our platform quickly and easily.

sdk/python.title: Python SDK
sdk/python.description: Our Python SDK provides a Pythonic interface to interact with the Terrarium API.
